website_summaries.verdict: The best budget drone accessory that will protect your prized flyer and make you a better pilot.
pros: Small landing pad provides a practice target to improve your piloting skills
The pad is gentle on the drone during rough landings to protect it from harmful rocks and terrain
cons: Size of pad requires some practice to land with consistency

customer_reviews.title: I love this landing pad
customer_reviews.text: I love this landing pad. At first glance, it might seem like such a minor accessory, but looks can be deceiving. The landing pad is durable and seems to be well constructed. It can be set up in seconds, and is very easy to take down. The pad has protected my drone, gimbal and camera from sand, dust, dirt, and ground moister. Even flying from low cut grass, I don’t have to worrry about the drone weed-walking. Knicks on the propellers can lead to in-air catastrophic failure. Camera gimbals can be very sensitive do dust or moisture and very expensive to replace. This is a cheap way to take good care of your “investment”.
customer_reviews.author: Shon Tamblyn

customer_reviews.title: This is a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I own a drone filming company and we fly about 30 drones of every shape and size. After using this one time just to keep a DJI Mavic pro platinum props out of the grass I found that when using the RTH feature, for some reason this orange side up makes the drone land literally pinpoint on the H. Every time. Also it folds into a small circle by twisting the outer edges and comes with a carry case that hold the stakes. I highly recommend this. Keeps my gimbals out of the grass!
customer_reviews.author: RTkeller

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you don't want to hand launch MPP
customer_reviews.text: Well made and tight as a drum. Great for keeping my Mavic Pro Platinum out of the grass and dirt. Also been sharing with a Phantom 4 pilot. The storage pouch keeps it in folded position and fits my flight bag. If you use the included plastic tent stakes make sure they are flush with the top of the pad or the Mavics props can hit them, without landing gear extensions. May get some wire stakes or not use them if it's not windy. Gives the Mavic a good Home Point reference for precision landing. And keeps people from standing where you're gonna be landing.
customer_reviews.author: Magilla Gorilla

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship watch out
customer_reviews.text: Well I went to use my pad for the first time I took out the pad and after it snapped into place like it should I noticed scratch marks on the orange side, which leads me to believe it was returned and repacked..I said well i can live with that so i went to zip up the pad after placing it in the bag and the bag tore at the zipper and then came off in my hand leaving a nice big hole..havent had much luck...purchasing from this company..I will give this company a chance to make good please send new bag..i will adjust review according to there actions
customer_reviews.author: joe materese

customer_reviews.title: It has held up well
customer_reviews.text: I have had the landing pad in my car for quite some time now. I don't use it every time I fly but it has definitely earned its keep. It is an ok size for my Mavic Pro. It would probably be ok for a Phantom as well but anything bigger than that I would certainly get a larger size pad. A side note / observation. If / when you use the tent stakes to hold it down (as you should) Be sure to sink them all the way down. You would not want your drone to either strike one of them with a rotor nor "trip" over one when on approach.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Beers

customer_reviews.title: Great drone pad
customer_reviews.text: This drone pad works nicely for take offs and landing drones. It comes in a nice bag so it doesn’t flop everywhere. Folding this was a bit of a nightmare. There are no folding instructions in the packaging, so a trip to YouTube to watch a video explaining the way to fold it was necessary. After that I folded it quickly but fear after a couple weeks, the next time I use it, another YouTube trip will be necessary. Great product though. Sturdy, bright, vibrant colors, and a nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Erik T.

customer_reviews.title: Very visible landing pad!
customer_reviews.text: This landing pad is quite visible... even from 100+ft (see photo). This springs open with quite a bit of force!! It’s not like you’d think, it’s got some umph behind it. Folds up to a nice small package, helps protect your quad during take off and landings. WELL worth the minimal investment!’
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: A necessity. 95% of the time it is near impossible to find a flat, dirt and grass free spot to launch and land my Mavic Air drone. This solves that problem perfectly. Keeps dust and dirt out of the drone's air vents, and grass out of the propellers, as well as providing a bright landing zone for the drone's return-to-home function. I keep the nylon carry bag attached to the handle of my drone carry case. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: James R. Gracen

customer_reviews.title: Does a most excellent job.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to want to fold back for storage. It just jumped out at me when I pulled it out. Readjustment edit: Due to my disabled hand, deploying the pad was a bit cumbersome. After more time using it, it was a lot better. Therefore, this product receives a better Rating. The spring metal memory folds back into a compact space. A clever feature.
customer_reviews.author: Gene S. Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This landing pad is very good quality. The metal ring is very stout and holds the pad open very nice. Because the ring is heavy duty in low winds I do not have to stake it down. It does come with these red reflectors but I am not sure where they go on the landing pad. As for folding it, it is really no different then a windshield sun shade or other circular items with a ring that you fold up. I think the people that are complaining about that are just whiny people and you will never make them happy. You should buy this if you have a drone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great landing pad for my drone!
customer_reviews.text: Nice landing pad for my drone. Comes with 3 stakes if needed to secure to the ground. Should also be good for RC helicopter landing pad. Drone flips if landing on grass, and this helps prevent that. It is easy to fold to place back in the case. Also comes with reflective red tape to apply to the landing pad to help see at night. I have not applied since I don't fly my drone at night.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Richard R. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Drone landing pad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drone landing pad because of my concern for my Mavic Pro's body lying so close to the ground. This is made of sturdy nylon materiel and has a very responsive metal coil sewn into its exterior. It folds up in a circular fashion just like the circular sun visors for the car windshields. When folded up it is no more than 7-8 inches in diameter but when opened it is about 3 feet diameter. I am very happy with this product. It has 2 different colors orange on one side and blue on the other.
customer_reviews.author: James Hysmith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome accessory - protected landing zone!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome accessory! Gives your drone a nice landing pad, protecting it from grass and weeds. Exactly as described, very attractive and solid. Folds up easily to slip back in its nice pouch. Includes 3 pegs to help secure the pad down. (Tip: push the pegs in at a steep angle, to leave as little protruding peg as possible, so the drone propellers can't catch on them.) Seems to help the drone land in the exact home spot--it seems to first come down via GPS, but then picks up the image, adjusts its position, and lands perfectly! There is an intangible joy to this too--a hi-tech landing pad no matter how rough and scramble is your terrain!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Aisa

customer_reviews.title: High quality, light weight and floss to a compact size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice landing pad for your drone. Bright clear markings on both sides, carry bag, and tie-down stakes included. Folds up to the size of a dinner plate. My Mavic 2 pro likes it because it will land exactly where it took off when in precision land mode. Great for non descriptive landing areas. Can be seen a long way off from camera POV for manual landings.
customer_reviews.author: samuel adams

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: This is a good aid in getting your drone back using the Return to Home feature (I fly the Mavic Pro). There are reflective stickers that come with it. Throw them out because they don't stick to the landing pad material and aren't necessary anyway. If you will be launching from sand, dirt, grass, etc., save your propeller blades and electronics and use a landing pad. This one comes with stakes to keep it in place if you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the DJI Mavic Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the DJI Mavic Pro. Helps keep dirt and debris away during takeoff and landing. It folds easily just like sun shades for a car. I recommend using slimmer metal tent or landscaping stakes that are much easier to get in and out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good solution to land on.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but I know this is going to be a better way to land on rather than carting some kind of flat hard board/cardboard or whatever if there isn't a flat surface available to land on. Just being able to pick a color to land on is helpful, it also comes with stakes to plant it into the ground so it won't catch the wind. Pouch is nice when you collapse the circle to fit. Defining an circular area to land is much easier for you to see and actually land appropriately without tipping the drone over.
customer_reviews.author: BGH

customer_reviews.title: Very nice addition for my drone to land on this Landing Pad
customer_reviews.text: Could have simply got a cheap door mat for a landing pad but this is easier to carry and looks much nicer then a door mat. Folds easily after learning the trick. It is light weight so make sure you secure to the ground with the accompanied stake's. You can see it well from your drone in the air. Prefer to use this pad verses landing on loose dusty soil or trying to land in tall grass.
customer_reviews.author: John T Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is surprisingly useful, particularly for Mavic owners or others with drones that have props close to the ground where they can hit even well-manicured grass. It also give my Mavic a visual target that ensures perfect placement in an automated landing. The steel ring inside is very heavy-duty, much more so than the typical children’s playhouse type. Overall, I’m impressed!
customer_reviews.author: C. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your drones
customer_reviews.text: Prevents dust and grass getting into your drone's motor. And most importantly its a lot easier to see the orange H from over 30 meters flying. So finding the landing spot is a breeze. You will always have a safe and clean spot to take off and land. My only issue is it came with no instructions on where you exactly put on the reflective red stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Ramir

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great...especially on the beach!
customer_reviews.text: Got it to have a safe spot for taking off and landing while on a cruise to 6 different islands. I needed a way to take off from anywhere. Love the fact that it has stakes that you use to make sure it stays in the ground and doesn't blow away. I have a Mavic Pro and a now a Mavic 2 Pro and love that this helps give the contrast needed for the landing system to be even more accurate. The only grip I have and why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is it isn't easy to fold back up. Takes a few tries to get it down.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic Block

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Very sturdy and large. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is almost perfect for drones. It is easy to open and comes with the stakes to keep it in the ground. It is light and pretty compact when folded up. There only issues I had was opening it the first time. Watch out, it opens fast and hard! Also, they included reflectors which do not seem to make any sense; you cannot add them to the pad and then still fold it up, and most drones do not allow night flights.
customer_reviews.author: John Emyril

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I have the thphoon h hexacoptor fits well and materials are good so far..if you are trying to land manually on this it will take skill for a hexacoptor..but if you are using a smaller quad like a mavic or a phantom you should have plenty of room..a must have if you want to keep debris from coming up and getting in your motors.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ilinsten

customer_reviews.title: A must-have to keep your drone from flying debris!
customer_reviews.text: Works great to keep dust, dirt and flying grass out of your drone motors when lifting off and landing. I even use magnets to attach it to the top of my car roof to keep it clean when I am using it in muddy or wet areas. I use my drone for tower inspections and need to fly when conditions are ok, but muddy or snowy - and this really helps.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and setup landing pad for your drone
customer_reviews.text: This is great for bringing the drone back to where it started when the ground location is otherwise indistinguishable and/or has grass/weeds that would interfere with the drone rotors. I've used mine with my Mavic Pro and it's amazing how close to the exact starting position/direction that the drone lands when it returns. Folds up nicely into the included carry case. This has become a required accessory for any flying that I do.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful
customer_reviews.text: Big and bright, I've tried using the stakes once but grass was solid and I didn't bring my hammer. Seems heavy enough on its own that a mavic air wont blow it away in different scenarios as long as outside wind is low. I can take off without my sensors and precision landing and turn on during RTH and mavic does precision landing no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Landing Pad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this landing pad for my Mavic Mini. I was having lots of trouble taking off from rocky / grassy areas without getting an alert from the drone saying my propellers were obstructed. This easy to use / fold landing pad instantly solved those problems. An added bonus is that the pad is easy to see from the air making any approach for landing very easy. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time when flying on-the-go. It really helps when using a mavic mini (since the landing gear is so small). I use it on uneven surfaces (grass, dirt, gravel, etc). It it very durable and easy to use. I just put if in my backpack (20L) along with my mavic mini and it was definitely a must have. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: They have used low quality materials. I just got it about couple of wks ago and the bag is torn out. And, I can see the the cloth material they used in the rim of the landing pad is tearing too. I'm a very careful handler and have handled it very lightly.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: just youtube how to launch and catch...
customer_reviews.text: these function alright, but I only used it once because it was to bulky to carry around, didn't really work in tall grass, and I found out that it is actually really easy to launch and catch your drone by hand instead of trying to figuring out how to make this work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Groneman

customer_reviews.title: Safe landing.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to see the quality better than I expected. Many may question why you would spend money on such an item. If you have ever been around a helicopter on take off or landing, the amount of dust dirt and debris is enough to chock a horse. Granted not as bad with your drone, but you are protecting your investment. Happy flying.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Bryant

customer_reviews.title: A MUST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a must if you fly drones it gives you a clean take off and return waterproof and comes with reflector tape to stick on the takeoff and launch pad so your drone can home in on low lighting it reflects that light so it has a better place to land after Dark.
customer_reviews.author: stacy cozart

customer_reviews.title: Little bulkier than expected
customer_reviews.text: It folds up nice and the pad seems to be good quality. But man it's bulky when folded - i wanted low profile landing pad but this one is an extra item to carry now so if you have a backpack then i guess it's fine. I haven't tested but have no doubt it will work well. The two colors indicate front/back, not two pads in case anybody was wondering (I wasn't).
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Chung

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought was a dumb idea, until I was landing my drone in a filed with high grass and the blades cut and threw grass all over the place... Now I just toss this down on the ground and have a landing pad that I don't need to be concerned with the height of the grass or weeds or whatever. . .
customer_reviews.author: Keith JonesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Everything is spot on with this however the adhesive reflective strips totally worthless if buying for that id try to find something where the H on the pad is reflective or I have looked at harbor freight for a solar light rope to put around it.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This one is absolutely perfect. I’ve used this a 100 times already and have had no problems. The quality seems pretty good. The only trick is learning how to twist it back down to size. You will learn this after 2-3 times. You can see it from the drone from way up (if your manually flying).
customer_reviews.author: Volvo 60R

customer_reviews.title: Needs repair after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: My drone blades caught the edge when landing and half of the surface is detached from the outer ring. Either throw away or hand sew it. Cost is cheap but so is the quality. It's the old saying you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Martyn E. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Funny watching my dad try to fold this back up. It is definitely sturdy! The H and ring on the oramge part kind of wash out in the video on the drone. So ur basically looking at an orange blob. But it works great. It was his fathers day present
customer_reviews.author: tmt520

customer_reviews.title: OK, but small
customer_reviews.text: The size is too small for my Mavic Pro. Does not work on RTH. Twice the drone landed partially outside. Avoidable. Get larger ones. The stakes are generic. too big. difficult to push in lawn/grassy land. Would need a mallet to be driven down. And if left protrudong out may damage the Propellers. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Anupam Gupta

customer_reviews.title: though it’s folded it’s still a bit large but I folding it’s good sized. Easy to stow and carry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before a trip. It came in a decent amount of time before my trip. Using it, though it’s folded it’s still a bit large but I folding it’s good sized. Easy to stow and carry. Quick to setup. It comes with plastic ground anchors so the pad doesn’t fly away which is convenient. I was specifically at how useful this was when flying my mavic pro. But after many flights I do like how it’s accurate when returning back home. It does t land RIGHT on the same point but it does get back to the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Kama Moiha

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Mavic!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy as it enables me to land my Mavic Pro in many more locations without fear of unlevel ground or kicked up dust damaging the drone. The carrying case is also handy, though it's starting to fray a little bit after only a month's use. All in all, great product, though perhaps a little overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Bargain!!
customer_reviews.text: hmm, buy this one, or spend double and get one with a brand name attached. Naw, I got this one and glad I did. Comes with all you need, a carry case, stakes to affix it to the ground if you want to, and its double sided. Fantastic construction and large enough for small to medium size drones.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Frady

customer_reviews.title: Great Home for Mavic Pro Drone!
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a good case, takes a couple of times to learn how to fold up but once figured out, it's a snap to fold and get back into case. Pleased with this item. Either side can be used to RTH for DJI Mavic Pro. Strongly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: MS Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Unit is fairly good construction but I can't figure out how to refold it!
customer_reviews.text: The unit is fairly good construction but I can't figure out how to refold it! I could have used some sort of explanation regarding how to fold it back up and put it back in it's carrying case....
customer_reviews.author: James M Murphy

customer_reviews.title: compact yet sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The Landing Pad is just as advertised. It is sturdy, light weight, and folds into a compact carry case! It is perfect for flying my Mavic in grassy areas where the sensors would prevent auto landing otherwise. It even comes with stakes to hold it in place; but, if it gets that windy I most likely will not be flying.
customer_reviews.author: William H Manifold

customer_reviews.title: Keeps drone up out of grass or dirt and debris
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive landing pad. Made with nice quality fabric and well constructed. Really folds out tightly. Three loops of fabric around side for included plastic stakes. Blue with white print on one side. Orange with white print on other side. Includes nice pouch that holds everything neatly and zips closed.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: How can I fold it up ?
customer_reviews.text: It leapt out of its packaging so quickly that I didn't have a chance to learn how to close it back up. I had a friend try and he couldn't do it either. There was no paper inside to explain it, and I can't figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Launch Pad
customer_reviews.text: Great pad for drone. Easy to open and easy to close. I hear people complaining it is hard. It is actually very easy. Just turn your hands in the opposite directions and it will fold right up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Coppock

customer_reviews.title: Big landing pad in a small package. Must have for drone pilots.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for what I needed. Folds up easy by simply grabbing the sides and twisting it. Packs away nicely and compact for easy transport. Just what I needed for my phantom 4 pro. Helps keep grass, dirt and debris away during takeoffs and landings. Also provides a great spot for the optical imaging used in precise landing mode. A must have for drone owners.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro

customer_reviews.title: Item came with small hole/rip along the black lining
customer_reviews.text: The landing pad came with a small hole or rip around the black lining. Seller refunded me but still disappointed in quality and must write it in the review for all to be aware of. I give this 3 stars for great customer service, but -2 due to product quality and wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fold
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect for my parrot bebop 2. Only have one issue it’s not easy to fold and they don’t give instructions on how to fold it. Had to watch a YouTube video on how to fold it back to fit the case
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: Compact, and super light weight.
customer_reviews.text: The Mavic 2 Pro will blow this thing away if it's not staked down. If it were weighted, it would be so much more convenient. I use it for takeoffs, but can't use it for landings unless I'm able to stake it down. Quality is good though. Lightweight, waterproof from what I've seen, and does the job well. No complaints other than not being able to stake it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fritchman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I received this landing pad within the quoted time. It comes with the items as described and is a great accessory for your drone. If you take off from grass or sand, this is must have item! I would recommend using the 3 pegs to keep in place before your drone takes off.
customer_reviews.author: Groovemaker2

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than I was expecting for my DJI Spark, it's 100x bigger than the Spark itself. I'll also be using it with the Skydio 2 once it comes out. I'm really liking the quality. No kinda issues with the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly how they described. I’ve had water floats that were made in similar way that you have to twist and fold to fit back into cover. That’s the hardest part of having one of these or a float. It’s not a manufacture prob it’s the nature of the way they’re made. 5 star all the way on this product minus the folding part. Bc of size I’m sure there’s not another way to make without having built in hinges which would make cost too expensive. Thx
customer_reviews.author: Stan Williams

customer_reviews.title: A must own
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know why I waited so long to get one of these but I finally did and I am glad I did. It was larger than I expected it to be and good quality. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Very wonderful Drone Landing Pad. It folds up and goes in the case that came with it, Very nice product. Our grandsons love it. Amazon Prime sent out right away!
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Tent Spikes To Big
customer_reviews.text: Pops out perfect, folds back up well. Good size. Sturdy. Spikes are too large and without soft ground they stickup enough to get in the propellers. Recommend small, simple metal tent spikes to pair with this product. I found 7" ones on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Ideal landing pad for MP2
customer_reviews.text: Ideal landing pad for M2P comes with 2 colors, several stakes & a carrying bag. Warning when you take out of bag it's like a Jackin box & just springs open lol. Now you have to master how to close the thing back up & put it back in & with a few attempts you finally cuss it out but defo tricky lol
customer_reviews.author: Rheabs

customer_reviews.title: what I like about it
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it has the pins to hold it to the ground. Ive tried others and they blow away from the prop wash. Also I love how taught it is. it makes landing on grass much easier and doesn't topple over. it overall it's just "cool"!! lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is a good quality pad, just that the reflector strips do not hold on the fabric , all what is let to do to be just perfect is ..........for my zino pro to find it, it misses it all the time,
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory, especially for mini-drones
customer_reviews.text: Takes a flick of your wrists to fold, takes a little practice. My mini-drone has no landing gear, so it was hard to land in grass, without damage.
customer_reviews.author: S. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for small to medium drone
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold and put in backpack. Need the supplied stakes on windy days. Very good for launching to keep the dirt and such still. Try your skill at landing in the center. Very goo purchase.
customer_reviews.author: misterdaveusa

customer_reviews.title: very glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure if it was needed, but I've since flown my drone in many places that may have caused issues with dust, sand, grass, etc... so having this landing pad helped limit the debris getting near the drone. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

customer_reviews.title: Your own Droneport
customer_reviews.text: This landing pad is great. Very well made and comes with a nice case. Perfect for takeoffs and landing of my DJI Mavic Air.Folding is slightly trick but practice makes perfect,
customer_reviews.author: Alan Mindel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome landing pad
customer_reviews.text: My wife surprised me with this to accompany my new drone. I've only seen these in video drone reviews and didn't know they are two-sided. I'm very happy with it and hope to have many safe landings on it!
customer_reviews.author: P. Draeger

customer_reviews.title: A Drone Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: This landing pad is pretty awesome! I really had no idea it was going to be so large based simply on the price I paid for it. It is really great for anyone that flies a drone. I highly recommend adding this extremely inexpensive accessory to your Drone equipment. For this price, why would anyone want to have their expensive Drone land in sand, dirty, grass, etc.?
customer_reviews.author: realjack.82

customer_reviews.title: major asset
customer_reviews.text: such a huge difference using this, precise auto landings now.. considering it's janurary and snow is on the ground, i had to catch my mavic which is easy to do but its a huge peace of mind knowing you can just hit rth and it'll land precisely where you took off. really awesome
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: a little bigger than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: but I found myself rarely using it. but definitely worth it for areas where it has high grass and you got to set it down
customer_reviews.author: Eye Lens Visuals

customer_reviews.title: Very big and easy to use after reviewing a video online.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Would have been nice to include a diagram inside the case. Had to go online to learn how to fold it up . Big enough for a 1 foot drone. Will blow away if you don't use included spikes
